verses.roman:
brahmāra eka dine tiṅho eka-bāra
avatīrṇa hañā karena prakaṭa vihāra

synonyms: brahmāra—of Lord Brahmā; eka—one; dine—in the day; tiṅho—He; eka-bāra—one time; avatīrṇa—descended; hañā—being; karena—performs; prakaṭa—manifest; vihāra—pastimes.
translation: Once in a day of Brahmā, He descends to this world to manifest His transcendental pastimes.
